intro: Pendressia wardellii, commonly known as the golden bell orchid, is a unique flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers that resemble small bells. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Pendressia wardellii has a short flowering period, usually in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
